title: Requirements for Dynamic Array - is_contains Feature

requirements.statement: The Dynamic Array shall provide a method `is_contains(value)` to check if the specified value exists in the array.
`is_contains(value)` shall return `true` if the value is found in the array, otherwise `false`.
The method shall not modify the array or its JSON file when performing the check.
The search operation shall run in O(n) time complexity for arrays of up to 1,000,000 elements.
The implementation shall be compatible with Python â‰¥ 3.9 across Linux, Windows, and macOS.

use_case.precondition: JSON file with a valid dynamic array exists.
steps: User specifies the value to check.
If the value is found, system returns `true`.
If the value is not found, system returns `false`.
use_case.postcondition: The system responds with a boolean value without modifying the JSON file.

acceptance_criteria: The method returns true when the value exists in the array.
The method returns false when the value does not exist in the array.
The operation does not modify the JSON file.
The method executes in O(n) time complexity.
